name: cifti-merge
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Merge or split on series, scalar, or label dimensions.

Given input CIFTI files for which mappings along the selected direction are the same type, all either series, scalars, or labels, and the other dimensions are index-compatible, this command concatenates the data in the specified indices/ranges along the selected direction (by default, on typical 2D cifti, concatenate horizontally, so rows become longer).  The direction can be either an integer starting from 1, or the strings 'ROW' or 'COLUMN'.

Example: wb_command -cifti-merge out.dtseries.nii -cifti first.dtseries.nii -index 1 -cifti second.dtseries.nii

This example would take the first column from first.dtseries.nii, followed by all columns from second.dtseries.nii, and write these columns to out.dtseries.nii.

inputs.name: opt_direction_direction
inputs.description: merge in a direction other than along rows: the dimension to split/concatenate along, default ROW

inputs.name: opt_mem_limit_limit_gb
inputs.description: restrict memory used for file reading efficiency: memory limit in gigabytes

inputs.name: cifti_in
inputs.description: a cifti file to use data from

inputs.name: index
inputs.description: select a single index to use

type.name: index
type.description: select a single index to use

inputs.name: index
inputs.description: the index number (starting from 1), or name

inputs.name: up_to
inputs.description: use an inclusive range of indices

type.name: up_to
type.description: use an inclusive range of indices

inputs.name: last_index
inputs.description: the number or name of the last index to include

inputs.name: opt_reverse
inputs.description: use the range in reverse order
